conclusion: Determine the maximum distance from the optical axis for an incident ray that emerges from the spherical surface of the hemisphere.
The critical angle for total internal reflection at the spherical surface is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/n.
From the diagram, the angle theta_c is related to the geometry of the hemisphere.
The maximum ray that emerges will strike the spherical surface at the critical angle.
In the triangle formed by point O, point P (where the ray hits the surface), and point Q (where the ray intersects the base), OP = R and OQ = d.
The maximum distance from the optical axis for the incident ray that emerges is d = (2/3)R.
